title: Hubble Snaps Galaxy Cluster’s Portrait
summary: A massive, spacetime-warping cluster of galaxies is the setting of today’s NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image. The galaxy cluster in question is Abell 209, located 2.8 billion light-years away in the constellation Cetus (the Whale). This Hubble image of Abell 209 shows more than a hundred galaxies, but there’s more to this cluster than even Hubble’s discerning […]

title: Federal Chancellor of Austria welcomed to ESA Headquarters
summary: On Friday 18 July, His Excellency Christian Stocker, Federal Chancellor of Austria, visited ESA Headquarters in Paris receiving a tour of the site from Director General Josef Aschbacher.

title: European firm has an ambitious plan to dock with the space station in 2028
summary: "One year ago, this was out of the discussion."

title: What You Need to Know About NASA’s SpaceX Crew-11 Mission
summary: Four crew members are preparing to launch to the International Space Station as part of NASA’s SpaceX Crew-11 mission to perform research, technology demonstrations, and maintenance activities aboard the orbiting laboratory.

title: Vision Changes on Space Station
summary: Science in Space July 2025 When astronauts began spending six months and more aboard the International Space Station, they started to notice changes in their vision. For example, many found that, as their mission progressed, they needed stronger reading glasses. Researchers studying this phenomenon identified swelling in the optic disc, which is where the optic […]

title: SpaceForest Expands Launch Plans with Portuguese Island Agreement
summary:
Poland-based rocket builder SpaceForest has signed an agreement with the Atlantic Spaceport Consortium to launch its Perun rocket from the Portuguese island of Santa Maria in 2026. SpaceForest began developing the one-stage 11.5-metre Perun sounding rocket under its Suborbital Inexpensive Rocket Project initiative in early 2018. The company launched a pair of test flights in […]
The post SpaceForest Expands Launch Plans with Portuguese Island Agreement appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Hubble Digs Up Galactic Time Capsule
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image features the field of stars that is NGC 1786. This globular cluster is located in the Large Magellanic Cloud (LMC), a small satellite galaxy of the Milky Way Galaxy that is approximately 160,000 light-years away from Earth. NGC 1786 itself is in the constellation Dorado. It was discovered in […]

title: New Apollo Earthrise view shows Juice’s RIME working well
summary: When the European Space Agency’s Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (Juice) flew past our Moon in August 2024, its Radar for Icy Moon Exploration (RIME) instrument listened to radio wave echoes to reveal the height of the lunar surface.
